image.altText: A woman wearing a black cap and a khaki vest smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Israel takes responsibility for a series of air strikes that killed several aid workers, including Australian "Zomi" Frankcom, in Gaza, as the country's PM Benjamin Netanyahu says "it happens in war".Â

title.children: Crews in Gaza took 'several hours' to recover bodies of aid workers, including Australian, after air strikes

image.altText: A graphic composite image of an illicit nicotine vape, the scales of justice and piles of cash

props.synopsis: There have been just 12 successful convictions for selling illegal nicotine vapes in NSW in 18 months. NSW Health Minister Ryan Park says the government will invest $4.3 million over three years in compliance and enforcement to stop illegal sales of the product.

title.children: For businesses selling illegal nicotine vapes, fines are just the 'cost of doing business'

image.altText: A young man with dark hair, a beard, a suit and glasses walks on the street.

props.synopsis: With the finish line in sight, the Federal Court has provided another twist in Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten after the broadcaster yesterday won its bid to reopen the case and put fresh evidence before the court.

title.children: What does the reopening of Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case mean for a judgment?

image.altText: Former PM Tony Abbott, smirking, sits next to Peter Dutton, smiling, in a joint party room meeting

props.synopsis: While we assume that federal politics is often an argument between two major parties or competing philosophies, there is another undercurrent that exists within governments and is blowing up again right now, which is: Politicians v Lawyers.

title.children: The wild scenes in an Abbott cabinet meeting that are still lingering a decade later

image.altText: A man sitting, with a suit on, looking on

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin is being humiliated in the Black Sea, where a third of Russia's naval fleet has been destroyed by Ukraine's attacks. Some say a plan to move the surviving vessels into a new port could draw a third country directly into the war.

title.children: After humiliations in the Black Sea, Putin has a devilishly clever plan to put Ukraine in a tricky place

image.altText: Mim Fox stands in a backyard garden slightly smiling

props.synopsis: Mim was denied credit from her bank because of her single status, but before that, she was ignored and "cut loose" when she asked for financial hardship help. She's not alone, with complaints about banks and lenders on the rise.Â Â

title.children: Rise in 'deeply concerning' complaints about banks not helping people in financial hardship

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu wears a suit and white shirt looking sternly

props.synopsis: Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom was one of seven people killed while working with the World Central Kitchen charity in central Gaza.

title.children: Penny Wong speaks after Israeli PM acknowledges responsibility for aid worker strike

image.altText: Gurjinder Singh with his arm aroundÂ Dharmvir Singh.

props.synopsis: While a two-year-old girl was saved, the girl's father Dharmvir Singh, 38, and grandfather Gurjinder Singh, 65, got into trouble in the pool's deep end and couldn't be revived.

title.children: The deaths of two men at a Gold Coast pool shocked Australia. Is it common for adult men to drown?

image.altText: Shoppers, some wearing face masks, walk past a sign that says Myer Stocktake Sale.

props.synopsis: An explosion of previously-inaccessible data is transforming the way the ABS goes about its job and is set to make statistics that used to be only fairly reliable suddenly very reliable.

title.children: From where we work to what we spend, the ABS knows more about us than ever before: here's what's changing

image.altText: A man with brown hair and a moustache on the left and above ground at a mine with piles of dirt and machinery.

props.synopsis: Internal emails show an engineer asked the Ballarat Gold Mine management in May last year not to proceed with a handheld drilling trial without "minimum" ground supports "to ensure that we all get home to our families".

title.children: Ballarat Gold Mine warned over potential for fatal rock fall months before miner's death

image.altText: A graphic showing the TikTok logo and three separte screenshots from social media videos showing cars hooning.

props.synopsis: The NT police commissioner says a dangerous gameÂ is being played byÂ young people in Alice Springs who post, then boast, about their crimes on social media. Experts say it's a nationwide issue.Â

title.children: Police concerned about rise in TikTok 'crimfluencers' in Alice Springs

image.altText: Bandt, in a puffy jacket, stands on the street behind a "Vote Yes" sign, handing out flyers.

props.synopsis: The Greens appear not to have made any major financial contribution to the Voice referendum campaign, according to figures released by the AEC on Tuesday, despite a withering internal battle that led to a senator quitting the party over her opposition.

title.children: Greens did not donate or spend money on Voice referendum campaign, according to AEC disclosures

image.altText: A police line running along the permiter of a land area with buildings and cars in the distance

props.synopsis: A 12-year-old child has been killed and two others seriously wounded in a shooting at a school in Finland, police said, with a fellow 12-year-old pupil suspected of the attack being taken into custody.

title.children: One child killed, two wounded in Finland school shooting, 12-year-old suspect in custody

image.altText: An elderly man with glasses sitting at a table lifting a fork with food to his mouth

props.synopsis: The family of missing 80-year-old Peter Roach says his Queensland hospital failed to keep him safe, as right to information documents show supervisors were not always informed when he left his ward.

title.children: Dementia patient escaped from hospital several times before disappearance, documents reveal

image.altText: Hannah Conda wears a blue dress with cape-like sleeves, staring into the camera with a determined look, pout and hand on hip.

props.synopsis: Competing against the globe's finest queens, Hannah Conda made the top two of RuPaul's Drag Race UK vs the World. She hopes it changes how people view our drag scene.

title.children: How Hannah Conda made the world take Down Under drag seriously, one slay at a time

image.altText: A flat white

props.synopsis: This is the little-known story of how Italian sugar growers in the Sunshine State are said to have inspired the "invention" of the flat white â a drink that would go on to become a global sensation.

title.children: It's now loved all over the world, but who really invented the flat white?

image.altText: Two women smile excitedly for a selfie.

props.synopsis: A friend and former colleague of killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom says the world has lost a "great helper" after several charity workers in Gaza die in a reported Israeli air strike.

title.children: Killed Australian aid worker's friend says Zomi Frankcom was 'relentless and huge-hearted'

image.altText: Smoke rising from Gaza after intense bombing.

props.synopsis: The US has in recent days reportedly green-lit the transfer of billions of dollars' worth of bombs to Israel, including warplanes and 900-kilogram bombs that have been blamed for mass civilian casualties.

title.children: Warplanes and 900-kilogram bombs that 'pancake buildings' among new weapons US reportedly sending IsraelÂ

image.altText: Firefighters stand out the front of a recently burnt-out building

props.synopsis: Eight people have been detained after the fire broke out during daytime renovation work at a nightclub which is underneath a 16-storey residential building.

title.children: Fire at Istanbul nightclub kills at least 29 people as investigations into the blaze continue

image.altText: Composite image of a young man taking into a mic, a blond woman looking into the camera and young woman with black hair singing

props.synopsis: From a new episode of Quiet on Set to JoJo Siwaâs edgy new look, hereâs what you missed in entertainment over the long weekend.

title.children: Rebel Wilson slams Fat Pizza and Grimsby co-star ahead of memoir drop, and more entertainment news

image.altText: A 'sold' sticker being placed on a 'for auction' sign outside a house.

props.synopsis: Terms like negative gearing and capital gains tax sound complicated but you shouldn't be put off by the financial jargon. You don't need to be a money expert to understand what they mean.Â

title.children: What is negative gearing? Why is it so controversial?

image.altText: Andrew Tate on private jet

props.synopsis: High school teacher Grace thought she'd landed her dream job. But she quit after one term when male students who were fans of self-described misogynist Andrew Tate made her feel unsafe.

title.children: Teachers are quitting due to Andrew Tate's ideology driving sexual harassment and misogyny in class

image.altText: A t-shaped copper IUD in front of a dark background with a pink sold out tag attached.

props.synopsis: Australian women are struggling to get copper intra-uterine devices (IUDs), with suppliers and authorities at odds over whether there is a shortage.

title.children: Patients struggle to access non-hormonal contraception amid confusion about supply

image.altText: Wires and components inside the Opal nuclear research reactor.

props.synopsis: For decades, Australians have been hesitant to embrace nuclear power â but there are signs attitudes might be shifting as younger Australians see climate change as their generation's existential threat.

title.children: The US and Japan have 'tripled down on nuclear', could it be time for Australia to shift its attitude?

image.altText: A man speaks into a microphone on a foreign television channel

props.synopsis: The Australian Federation of Ukrainian Organisations said comments made by Port Hedland councillor Adrian McRae in praise of the Russian election has left some members "in tears".

title.children: Australia's Ukrainian community distressed by WA councillor's pro-Russian election comments

image.altText: A group of detectives surround a man wearing a white forensic suit near a bus stop.

props.synopsis: In sentencing 36-year-old Warren Dhamarrandji in the NT Supreme Court, Justice John Burns said he had demonstrated an "alarming attitude" towards women built on a belief he was entitled to "severely punish disobedience".Â Â

title.children: Man sentenced to life in prison for stabbing murder of girlfriend in Darwin park

image.altText: A serious balding older man with grey hair and beard, waers blue tee, looks away from camera. Blurred greenery behind.

props.synopsis: This third-generation logger says he is on the verge of bankruptcy while environmental advocates say they will continue to put pressure on the industry until native forest logging is banned.Â Â

title.children: Timber worker fears collapse of industry will be the death of regional hubs on NSW coast

image.altText: Wendy Ruth Sym with a friend.

props.synopsis: A former nurse was struggling to care for her dementia-affected husband when she tried to kill him by injecting him with insulin, a Perth court has been told.

title.children: 'She loved him too much': Nurse denies trying to kill dementia-affected husband

image.altText: A shirtless Indian man with a long beard does yoga on a platform beside a large river.

props.synopsis: The court said it was not convinced by an "unqualified apology" the guru's company filed last month, which described some Indian drug laws as "archaic".

title.children: Court tells India's top yoga guru to stop running ads saying traditional medicines can fully cure diseases

image.altText: Part of the steel bridge span is smashed on top of a loaded cargo ship.

props.synopsis: The United States Coast Guard has opened a temporary, alternate channel for vessels involved in clearing debris from the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge in Baltimore, part of a phased approach to opening the main shipping channel leading to the vital port.

title.children: Alternate channel for vessels helping with clean-up opened after Baltimore bridge collapse

image.altText: A graphic showing a young boy looking up at an illustration of a brain

props.synopsis: The federal government has released a draft of its national autism strategy, which aims to improve life outcomes for autistic Australians.

title.children: Autistic people die 20 years earlier than the rest of Australia. Can a national plan turn that around?
